programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isn’t the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. We’ll also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchester’s new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks. - GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits the G2 Ranch along with life time TTHA member Owen West. Owen has been a member and volunteer for Texas Trophy Hunters for 46 years and was invited to share camp with us. It was a hunt he never dreamed would happen in his lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. From fishing to waterfowl, we have found that every hunt gives us a chance to experience other people's stories. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.
Brady Snyder hunts down a giant Iowa buck on public land.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we take you to historic Saint Francisville, Louisiana. We closed on a couple of real estate properties in this area and want to show you why this area is so unique from a recreational standpoint. This place holds the “old south” feel that is ever so fleeting. We hunt on a property I sold to a client last year in Saint Francisville and manage to get a beautiful longbearded turkey on the ground. This episode is one you definitely don’t want to miss.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins a local legend in the waters of Amelia Island, exploring its rich fishery and targeting redfish, trout, and more in this coastal gem.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: When crappies post up in tough cover there is no better technique than a drop shot rigged with one of Freedom Baitz's newest plastic!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Dragging jigs for clear water walleyes just got a lot easier with the NEW Tungsten Stand Up jig from Northland!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: If you’re looking for the ultimate fishing adventure then you need to give Knobby's Fly-In Lodge and Outpost a look! We had a unbelievable trip!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Cold water situations for Bass are ideal for crankbaits. Knowing which type of crankbaits works best is critical - make sure you have a few flat sided!

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, & Chris Hammaway join Capt. Jared Raskob in Los Cabos on the hunt for Striped Marlin Part 1.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, & Chris Hammaway join Capt. Jared Raskob in Los Cabos on the hunt for Striped Marlin Part 2.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Great views, Food and people. Danny learns to fly fish on the iconic Madison River in Ennis, Montana.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: The Montana adventure continues on private lakes targeting trophy trout. This is where fish stories are born.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode, we will explore where the locals dive and experience the underwater gems where the natives love to hang out in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you to some of the wrecks in the Florida Keys that locals love to dive and share their rich history and the stories held deep aboard these sunken ships. We will also take a deep dive and discuss how these wrecks are critical to the environment.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will follow people rethinking how they can make a difference by volunteering to help the environment in the Florida Keys. Whether you are traveling to the Keys on vacation or you live there, people are making a difference by giving back.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.sub-title: "Groups working to restore our vital ecosystems"
programme.desc: We highlight organizations and programs making a difference in the Florida Keys. Learn how they help protect and restore these vital ecosystems.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Meet Danny Pruitt as he shows off his home town. Fishing for pan fish and showing off what Dawsonville, GA has to offer.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Great views, Food and people. Danny learns to fly fish on the iconic Madison River in Ennis, Montana.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: The Montana adventure continues on private lakes targeting trophy trout. This is where fish stories are born.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This episode is all about thanking our service men and women who have served or are still currently serving; Our pals Wes Thomas and Terry McWilliams join in to help thank these heroes, along with great companies like IN 811 and Centerpoint; special thanks to West Bogg Park for having us again this year.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we join professional angler, Andrew Nordbye, for a cold day on Guntersville to catch some giant crappie; traveling through a major winter storm and arriving at an abandoned lake was the not-surprising scene for the day. Andrew's priorities are in order when it comes to his marriage, his faith, and his family, including just-arrived new babies...but he sill made time to squeeze in this day on water with us!

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week, we reflect on a tragic and sad memory in our lives as we remember a dear childhood friend of my son Nick, Nathan Wimsatt. Our families have been close for man years and shared a lot of time together around the soccer field, vacations, fishing trips, and much more. Nathan passed in a tragic car accident at only 18 years on April 29th, 2023. This week his Dad Brian is joining me on Lake Taylorsville where we'll share some memories and celebrate Nathan's life...that ended way to soon!

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we're joined by our good friend and Worship Leader, Rob Key. A tremendous musical talent that's chased the country music dream, but found his calling as worship leader at Taylorsville Community Church. Rob's love for serving the Lord is his top priority, but he certainly enjoys the great outdoors and especially doing a little fishing.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.sub-title: "2 Limits Of Ducks And 2 Swamp Bucks"
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Charles Rodney’s relationship with his hunting dogs, passion for field-to-table living and connection to the land make his love for chasing rabbits contagious while the heritage of Winchester’s small game ammunition makes this beloved pastime accessible for generations to come. Also: a Model 42 collection for the ages and hunting Kansas coyotes with the Keefer Brothers.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at - John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY. They are checking out some of the damage done to John’s pontoon decking from freezing weather they received. John and the team are upgrading the material, and adding carpeting to the pontoon decking. We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.sub-title: Getaway - "Scenic Rivers Gems of the Seine 2"
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This spring, our crew was able to dive into some turkey hunting at the G2 ranch with long time TTHA Members Mike Reeber and Dan Marcasol. After a slow start, the crew was finally able to connect on a great Rio Tom and a few hogs. Learning and sharing the stories of TTHA members is something we strive to do each year.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.
